page.title: 11FARMING
page.content: Half the farms in this area are mixed the others are either arable or dairy. In this area there should be about 3662 acres of land. The farmers have lived at their farms from 2\ years to 25 years. Depending on the size of the farm, the number of workers varies from just the farmer to about 6 workers. Most of the farms have at least 3 tractors and 1 bailer. The types of food that the animals eat are cake, grass, skimmed milk, barley and hay. The usual times of milking the cows are 6am aand 4pm. Out of two farms in the area one gets 735 maximum and the other gets 4500 litres of milk. One farm didn't have any cows whereas the largest herd was 320. Friesian,Hereford, Guernsey and Jersey cows are the most popular. The main crops are barley, wheat, oats, maize, rape, peas, and meadow hay.
